name: Dinner Tonight: Warm Cannellini Bean and Herb Salad
description: The most important thing to remember when making this recipe is low, gentle, barely flickering heat. This is not a "hot" bean salad, it's a warm one, and delicate heat preserves the flavor of its ingredients. Quality herbs and olive...
recipeIngredient: 2 14 oz cans cannellini or other white beans, rinsed and drained, about 3 cups
2 garlic cloves, peeled and finely chopped
1-2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh rosemary leaves
Juice of 1 lemon (I often add zest as well)
1/2 cup good oil cured black olives (optional)

recipeInstructions.text: In large sauté pan combine oil, garlic and herbs. Warm over very low heat for about 4 min, or until the garlic and herbs release their aroma.
Add the beans (and shrimp if using), salt and pepper to taste, and toss gently. Cook over low heat until the beans are warm and have absorbed the flavors of the olive oil, about 5 min.
Remove from the heat and add the lemon juice. Toss very gently, place on a serving platter, and surround with black olives.
